entries.meaning: (genetics) The breeding of an individual with a phenotypically recessive individual, in order to determine the zygosity of the former by analysing proportions of offspring phenotypes.
examples: The inbreds of groups 3 and 4 have a distinct difference in plant height, except for a few selections, presumably because of some difference in selection pressure at low- and high-stand densities. Group means for testcross performance showed more progress in group 4 than in group 3 because of a difference in the number of low-yielding genotypes in the two groups.

verbs.description: testcross (third-person singular simple present testcrosses, present participle testcrossing, simple past and past participle testcrossed)

entries.meaning: (genetics) To breed an individual in this manner.
